result.execSummary:
The defendant Jerome Lamar Toles was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Jerome Lamar Toles in court with attorney James C. McLaughlin.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DE advised of rights and penalties; DE waives rights; parties stipulate to facts, DEF pleads NC to cT#1 found guilt,
Court on CT#1 sentences DEF to 6 months county jail with huber IMPOSED & STAYED  1year probation conditions of probation no contact with L Stojek, fine/cost $579.00    Def. to report to Probation & Parole today.
